Class DepositSlot

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.deposit.DepositSlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
DepositSubject
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultDeposit, LeaderDeposit
public abstract class DepositSlot
extends java.lang.Object
implements DepositSubject

  • Method Details

    • simpleCanAddToDepositSlot

      public abstract boolean simpleCanAddToDepositSlot​(ResourceContainer inputContainer)
      It's the function that gives the permission to add or not to the Controller
      Returns:
      true if he can add the resources

    • canAddToDepositSlot

      public abstract boolean canAddToDepositSlot​(ResourceContainer inputContainer) throws DifferentResourceType, DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded, ResourceTypeAlreadyStored
      It's the function that gives the permission to add or not to the Controller
      Returns:
      true if he can add the resources
      Throws:
      DifferentResourceType - when there is a ResourceType mismatch
      DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded - when it would add too many resources
      ResourceTypeAlreadyStored

    • addToDepositSlot

      public abstract boolean addToDepositSlot​(ResourceContainer inputContainer)
      It's the function that gives the permission to remove or not to the Controller
      Returns:
      true if he can

    • canRemoveFromDepositSlot

      public abstract boolean canRemoveFromDepositSlot​(ResourceContainer inputContainer) throws DifferentResourceType, NotEnoughResources
      Tells the controller if a container can be removed
      If the user is sending multiple containers it also check if he has (inputQty + bufferQty)
      Returns:
      true if there were no errors
      Throws:
      DifferentResourceType
      NotEnoughResources

    • removeFromDepositSlot

      public abstract boolean removeFromDepositSlot​(ResourceContainer inputContainer)
      removes the quantity from a resourceContainer It needs to be called after CanRemoveFromDepositSlot if the user wants to follow the rules
      Returns:
      true if there were no exceptions

    • canTransferTo

      public abstract boolean canTransferTo​(DepositSlot destination, int quantityThatIWantToSwitch) throws NotEnoughResources, DifferentResourceType, DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded, ResourceTypeAlreadyStored
      gives the controller the permission to move a desired quantity from one deposit to another
      Parameters:
      destination - is the deposit where the user wants the resources to be moved
      Returns:
      true if the selected deposit can transfer his resources to another generic deposit
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResources - if the user wants to move a quantity that's greater than the selected deposit's max dimension
      DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded - if in the destination deposit there's not enough space to insert the transferred resources
      DifferentResourceType - if the selected slot has some ResourceType restrictions
      ResourceTypeAlreadyStored

    • transferTo

      public boolean transferTo​(DepositSlot destination, int quantityThatIWantToTransfer)
      Transfer a desired quantity from one deposit to another one Sets the target deposit's ResourceType equal as this ResourceType
      Parameters:
      destination - is the deposit where the user wants the resources to be placed
      Returns:
      true

    • canSwitchWith

      public abstract boolean canSwitchWith​(DepositSlot destination) throws DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded, ResourceTypeAlreadyStored
      Used when the Deposit's type allows the storage of different ResourceType Gives the controller the permission to switch a desired quantity from one deposit to another
      Parameters:
      destination - is the deposit that will switch resources with the selected one
      Returns:
      true if the Deposit's type can switch his resources with another generic deposit
      Throws:
      ResourceTypeAlreadyStored - if the user wants to move already stored ResourceTypes
      DepositSlotMaxDimExceeded - if in the destination deposit there's not enough space to insert the transferred resources

    • switchTo

      public boolean switchTo​(DepositSlot destination)
      Switches two deposit's resources if they can store different ResourceType
      Parameters:
      destination - it's the deposit that will switch the resources with This

    • addToBuffer

      public boolean addToBuffer​(ResourceContainer inputContainer)
      Adds an input to the buffer that handles one transaction It is called when the user decides to buy one card or to produce: it adds the price or the input requirement for the production to the buffer after the canRemove(price/productionInput)
